---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Very well done indeed! I've left a bunch of mostly minor comments.
Very well done indeed! I've left a bunch of mostly minor comments.

Thanks!

bors d+
Why the dot + indentation?

```suggestion
# Various results about unramified algebras

We prove various theorems about unramified algebras. In fact we work in the more general setting
of formally unramified algebras which are essentially of finite type.
```

```suggestion
## Main results

```

```suggestion
    rw [← sub_sub_self 1 t] at ht₁; generalize 1 - t = e at *
```
Somehow seems a little less excessive.

My instinct was "e is in the annihilator of 1-e because it's in the ideal generated by things in the annihilator of 1-e" but is this no quicker? Are we missing API for annihilators of elements of rings?

```suggestion
      linear_combination ht₁ s
```
My instinct is "use the big tactic rather than several small theorems" but this is a style question really.

```suggestion
See `Algebra.FormallyUnramified.iff_exists_tensorProduct`.
```

```suggestion
    · intro; simp only [zero_smul]
    · intro; simp only [zero_smul]
    · intros; simp only [add_smul]
```
Do you think this is better?

```suggestion
    simp (config := {contextual := true})
```
Not sure if this is any better really, it's a bit more obscure but it's how to do "intro stuff, simp using the stuff".
These comments are confusing. You're using `s` to mean both a finite set and an element of an unspecified set, and you have an undefined a_i.

```suggestion
    · intro; simp
    · intro; simp
```
You don't need them so I'm not sure there's any point in putting them, like you wouldn't put `apply foo _`.

```suggestion
  -- `∑ₛ fᵢbᵢ = 1` and `∀ x : S, xfᵢ ⊗ bᵢ = aᵢ ⊗ xfᵢ` which exists since `S` is unramified over `R`.
```

Do you think this element will be used outside this file? Asking because in that case it is probably better to prove everything for a generic `t` such that blah blah, rather than only for the one given by `choose`.
Maybe, but I don't think the element itself is important as long as it exists.
Yes sure, but this is exactly my point: your lemmas don't apply to another element with the same property. Anyway it's not very important, we can always fix this later.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Unramified): Unramified + free => finite
